text: The Second Temple (Hebrew: בית המקדש, Holy House) was the reconstructed Temple in Jerusalem which stood between 516 BC and 70 AD. It is also known as the Herod's Temple. Back then, it was the center of Jewish worship. The Romans burned down Jerusalem and its Second Temple on August 4, 70 AD after crushing a Jewish revolt against their colonial rule. * * * * * * * * * * ==Related pages== *Jerusalem *Western Wall *History of Jews *Haredi Judaism *Orthodox Judaism *Conservative Judaism ==Other websites== *About the Temple of Jerusalem *Jewish Encyclopedia: Temple, The Second *Resources > Second Temple and Talmudic Era > Second Temple Jerusalem The Jewish History Resource Center, Project of the Dinur Center for Research in Jewish History, The Hebrew University of Jerusalem ==References== Category:70 Category:510s BC Category:Temple Mount Category:Ancient Israel and Judah Category:Buildings and structures in Jerusalem Category:1st millennium BC buildings and structures Category:1st-century disestablishments
title: Second Temple
